heading: sun beefs up with forte
subheading: the software developer will add to sun's portfolio of servers and workstations in a us$540 million deal.
author: reuters
text: palo alto, california -- sun microsystems said monday that it agreed to acquire software developer forte software inc. for us$540 million in stock in a deal that will expand sun's portfolio of network servers, workstations, and software. under terms of the agreement, each share of forte common stock will be converted into 0.3 shares of sun micro common stock.the acquisition helps sun bulk up its network computing operation. forte, headquartered in oakland, california, has a strong position in the market for scalable distributed application development and enterprise application integration. both complement sun micro's java platform, as well as other network computing technologies, the company said.the $540 million value, about $22.275 per forte share, is based on sun's friday closing price of $74.25. shares of forte closed at $17 on friday, just shy of their 52-week high of $17.125 a share.the merger is expected to close by the end of the year, which is the second quarter of sun's fiscal 2000. the deal is still subject to approval by the government and forte shareholders.following the acquisition, forte will operate under its own name as a subsidiary of sun microsystems. the acquisition will be accounted for as a pooling of interests.sun is the no. 1 systems maker running on unix machines, where its computers dominate the market. in the overall data storage market for computers ranging from personal computers to mainframes, sun ranks no. 4, with about an 8 percent share.copyright
